name: chat.postMessage
desc: Sends a message to a channel.

channel.desc: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See below for more details.

attachments.desc: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

blocks.desc: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

text.desc: How this field works and whether it is required depends on other fields you use in your API call. See below for more detail.

as_user.desc: (Legacy) Pass true to post the message as the authed user instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. Can only be used by classic Slack apps. See authorship below.

icon_emoji.desc: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url.

icon_url.desc: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message.

link_names.desc: Find and link user groups. No longer supports linking individual users; use syntax shown in Mentioning Users instead.

metadata.desc: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string. Metadata you post to Slack is accessible to any app or user who is a member of that workspace.

mrkdwn.desc: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to false. Enabled by default.

parse.desc: Change how messages are treated. See below.

reply_broadcast.desc: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.

thread_ts.desc: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

unfurl_links.desc: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

unfurl_media.desc: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

arg_groups.desc: One of these arguments is required to describe the content of the message. If attachments or blocks are included, text will be used as fallback text for notifications only.
